01868 ! INPUTS
01869 !   pGrd - Pointer to the model grid data structure.
01870 !   pConfig - Pointer to the model configuration data structure.
01871 !   iDayOfYear - Day of the current year (January 1 = 1).
01872 !   iMonth - Month corresponding to the current model day (January = 1).
01873 !
01874 ! OUTPUTS
01875 !   NONE
01876 !
01877 ! NOTES
01878 !   ** Code refers to parameters that are set within types.f95.
01879 !   ** Code directly modifies model grid values through the manipulation
01880 !       of pointers.
01881 !
01882 ! SOURCE
01883 
01884 subroutine model_RunoffDownhill(pGrd, pConfig, iDayOfYear, iMonth)
01885 
01886   ! [ ARGUMENTS ]
01887   type ( T_GENERAL_GRID ),pointer :: pGrd          ! pointer to model grid
01888   type (T_MODEL_CONFIGURATION), pointer :: pConfig ! pointer to data structure that contains
01889                                                    ! model options, flags, and other settings
01890   integer (kind=T_INT),intent(in) :: iDayOfYear
01891   integer (kind=T_INT), intent(in) :: iMonth       ! Integer month value (1-12)
01892   ! [ LOCALS ]
01893   integer (kind=T_INT) :: ic,iTgt_Col,iTgt_Row,iFrac
01894   real (kind=T_SGL) :: rP,rR,rDelta
01895   type (T_CELL),pointer :: cel
01896 
01897 
01898   ! Reset the upstream flows (note that iOrderCount, iOrderCol, and iOrderRow are globals)
01899   do ic=1,iOrderCount
01900 
01901     cel => pGrd%Cells(iOrderRow(ic),iOrderCol(ic))
01902     call model_DownstreamCell(pGrd,iOrderRow(ic),iOrderCol(ic),iTgt_Row,iTgt_Col)
01903 
01904 #ifdef STREAM_INTERACTIONS
01905     cel%rStreamCapture = rZERO
01906 #endif
01907 
01908     ! Compute the runoff
01909     cel%rOutFlow = rf_model_CellRunoff(pConfig, cel, iDayOfYear)
01910 
01911     ! Now, route the water
01912     if ( iTgt_Row == iROUTE_LEFT_GRID ) then
01913       cel%rFlowOutOfGrid = cel%rOutflow
01914       cel%rOutFlow = rZERO
01915       cycle
01916     elseif ( iTgt_Row == iROUTE_DEPRESSION ) then
01917       ! Don't route any further; the water pools here.
01918       cel%rOutFlow = rZERO
01919       cycle
01920     endif
01921 
01922     ! MUST screen target values to ensure we don't start attempting
01923     ! manipulation of memory that is out of bounds!!
01924     call Assert(LOGICAL(iTgt_Row>0 .and. iTgt_Row <= pGrd%iNY,kind=T_LOGICAL), 
01925         "iTgt_Row out of bounds: Row = "//int2char(iOrderRow(ic)) 
01926         //"  Col = "//int2char(iOrderCol(ic)), 
01927         trim(__FILE__),__LINE__)
01928     call Assert(LOGICAL(iTgt_Col>0 .and. iTgt_Col <= pGrd%iNX,kind=T_LOGICAL), 
01929         "iTgt_Col out of bounds: Row = "//int2char(iOrderRow(ic)) 
01930         //"  Col = "//int2char(iOrderCol(ic)), 
01931         trim(__FILE__),__LINE__)
01932 
01933 #ifdef STREAM_INTERACTIONS
01934 
01935     if(pGrd%Cells(iTgt_Row,iTgt_Col)%iStreamIndex > 0) then
01936       ! route outflow to a specific stream or fracture ID
01937       cel%rStreamCapture = cel%rOutFlow
01938       cel%rOutFlow = rZERO
01939     else if &
01940 #else
01941     if &
01942 #endif
01943       (pGrd%Cells(iTgt_Row,iTgt_Col)%iLandUse == pConfig%iOPEN_WATER_LU &
01944       .or. pGrd%Cells(iTgt_Row,iTgt_Col)%rSoilWaterCap<rNEAR_ZERO) then
01945       ! Don't route any further; the water has joined a generic
01946       ! surface water feature. We assume that once the water hits a
01947       ! surface water feature that the surface water drainage
01948       ! network transports the bulk of it
01949       ! out of the model domain quite rapidly
01950       cel%rFlowOutOfGrid = cel%rOutflow
01951       cel%rOutFlow = rZERO
01952 
01953     else
01954       ! add cell outflow to target cell inflow
01955 !      tcel%rInFlow = tcel%rInFlow + cel%rOutFlow
01956        pGrd%Cells(iTgt_Row,iTgt_Col)%rInFlow = &
01957           pGrd%Cells(iTgt_Row,iTgt_Col)%rInFlow + cel%rOutFlow * cel%rRouteFraction
01958        cel%rFlowOutOfGrid = cel%rOutflow * &
01959                               (rONE - cel%rRouteFraction)
01960        cel%rOutflow = cel%rOutflow * cel%rRouteFraction
01961     end if
01962 
01963   end do
01964 
01965   return
01966 end subroutine model_RunoffDownhill
01967 
01968 !!***
01969 
01970 !--------------------------------------------------------------------------
01971 !!****s* model/model_Runoff_NoRouting
01972 ! NAME
01973 !   model_Runoff_NoRouting - Removes any computed runoff directly from the
01974 !                            model domain.
01975 ! SYNOPSIS
01976 !   This subroutine makes a single pass through all grid cells in the
01977 !   model domain in order to calculate surface water runoff. The grid
01978 !   cells farthest upstream are solved first. Calculation of runoff amounts
01979 !   proceeds from upstream to downstream until a calculation has been made
01980 !   for all grid cells.
01981 !
01982 !   NOTE that this version performs *NO* routing, but simply removes any
01983 !   runoff directly from the model domain.
01984 !
01985 ! INPUTS
01986 !   pGrd - Pointer to the model grid data structure.
01987 !   pConfig - Pointer to the model configuration data structure.
01988 !   iDayOfYear - Day of the current year (January 1 = 1).
01989 !   iMonth - Month corresponding to the current model day (January = 1).
01990 !
01991 ! OUTPUTS
01992 !   NONE
01993 !
01994 ! NOTES
01995 !   ** Code refers to parameters that are set within types.f95.
01996 !   ** Code directly modifies model grid values through the manipulation
01997 !       of pointers.
01998 !
01999 ! SOURCE
02000 
02001 subroutine model_Runoff_NoRouting(pGrd, pConfig, iDayOfYear, iMonth)
02002 
02003   ! [ ARGUMENTS ]
02004   type ( T_GENERAL_GRID ),pointer :: pGrd          ! pointer to model grid
02005   type (T_MODEL_CONFIGURATION), pointer :: pConfig ! pointer to data structure that contains
02006                                                    ! model options, flags, and other settings
02007   integer (kind=T_INT),intent(in) :: iDayOfYear
02008   integer (kind=T_INT), intent(in) :: iMonth       ! Integer month value (1-12)
02009   ! [ LOCALS ]
02010   integer (kind=T_INT) :: iCol,iRow, iFrac
02011   real (kind=T_SGL) :: rR
02012   type (T_CELL),pointer :: cel
02013   ! [ CONSTANTS ]
02014 
02015   do iCol=1,pGrd%iNX
02016     do iRow=1,pGrd%iNY
02017 
02018       cel => pGrd%Cells(iRow,iCol)
02019 
02020       ! Compute the runoff for each cell
02021       rR = rf_model_CellRunoff(pConfig, cel, iDayOfYear)
02022 
02023       ! Now, remove any runoff from the model grid
02024 !      call stats_UpdateAllAccumulatorsByCell(REAL(rR,kind=T_DBL), &
02025 !         iRUNOFF_OUTSIDE,iMonth,iZERO)
02026 
02027        cel%rFlowOutOfGrid = rR
02028 !       cel%rOutFlow = rR
02029 
02030 !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
02031 !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
02032 !! What is the point of this? If we aren't routing,
02033 !! only a small amount of water (generated from a
02034 !! cell directly beneath a stream segment) will
02035 !! be captured...
02036 !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
02037 #ifdef STREAM_INTERACTIONS
02038     ! Capture into streams or fractures
02039     cel%rStreamCapture = rZERO
02040     if ( cel%iStreamIndex /= 0 ) then
02041       ! Compute the amount of fracture recharge
02042       cel%rStreamCapture = cel%rInFlow * pconfig%rStreamMaxCapture(cel%iStreamIndex) &
02043                                        / pconfig%rStreamMaxInflow(cel%iStreamIndex)
02044       if (cel%rStreamCapture < rZERO) then
02045          print *, "Negative!", cel%rInFlow, cel%rStreamCapture
02046       endif
02047       cel%rOutFlow = cel%rOutFlow - cel%rStreamCapture
02048     end if
02049 #endif
02050 
02051       ! we've removed the water from the grid; it shouldn't be included in
02052       ! "outflow" water
02053       cel%rOutFlow = rZERO
02054 
02055     end do
02056   end do
02057 
02058   return
02059 
02060 end subroutine model_Runoff_NoRouting
02061 
02062 !!***
02063 
02064 !--------------------------------------------------------------------------
02065 !!****f* model/if_model_RunoffIteration
02066 ! NAME
02067 !   if_model_RunoffIteration -
02068 !
02069 !
02070 ! SYNOPSIS
02071 !
02072 ! INPUTS
02073 !   pGrd - Pointer to the model grid data structure.
02074 !   pConfig - Pointer to the model configuration data structure.
02075 !   iDayOfYear - Day of the current year (January 1 = 1).
02076 !   iMonth - Month corresponding to the current model day (January = 1).
02077 !
02078 ! OUTPUTS
02079 !   NONE
02080 !
02081 ! NOTES
02082 !   ** Code refers to parameters that are set within types.f95.
02083 !   ** Code directly modifies model grid values through the manipulation
02084 !       of pointers.
02085 !
02086 ! SOURCE
02087 
02088 function if_model_RunoffIteration(pGrd, pConfig, iDayOfYear, iMonth) result(iCount)
02089   !! Performs one runoff iteration for the specified amount of precip.
02090   ! [ ARGUMENTS ]
02091   type ( T_GENERAL_GRID ),pointer :: pGrd          ! pointer to model grid
02092   type (T_MODEL_CONFIGURATION), pointer :: pConfig ! pointer to data structure that contains
02093                                                    ! model options, flags, and other settings
02094   integer (kind=T_INT),intent(in) :: iDayOfYear
02095   integer (kind=T_INT), intent(in) :: iMonth       ! Integer month value (1-12)
02096   ! [ RETURN VALUE ]
02097   integer (kind=T_INT) :: iCount
02098   ! [ LOCALS ]
02099   integer (kind=T_INT) :: iCol,iRow,iTgt_Row,iTgt_Col
02100   real (kind=T_SGL) :: rR,rDelta
02101   type (T_CELL),pointer :: cel,tcel
02102   real (kind=T_DBL) :: xmin, xmax, ymin, ymax
02103 !  real (kind=T_SGL) :: rMonthlyRunoffOutside, rDailyRunoffOutside
02104 
02105   ! [ CONSTANTS ]
02106 
02107   ! reset the term for tracking outflow from one iteration to the next
02108   rDelta = rZERO
02109 
02110   ! Reset the upstream flows
02111   iCount = 0
02112 
02113   do iCol=1,pGrd%iNX
02114     do iRow=1,pGrd%iNY
02115       cel => pGrd%Cells(iRow,iCol)
02116       call model_DownstreamCell(pGrd,iRow,iCol,iTgt_Row,iTgt_Col)
02117 
02118       if ( iTgt_Row == iROUTE_DEPRESSION ) then
02119         ! Don't route any further; the water pools here.
02120         cel%rOutFlow = rZERO
02121 !        call stats_UpdateAllAccumulatorsByCell(rD_ZERO, &
02122 !            iRUNOFF_OUTSIDE,iMonth,iZERO)
02123         cycle
02124       end if
02125 
02126       ! Compute the runoff
02127       rR = rf_model_CellRunoff(pConfig, cel, iDayOfYear)
02128 
02129       if( iTgt_Row == iROUTE_LEFT_GRID ) then
02130         rDelta = rR - cel%rFlowOutOfGrid
02131         cel%rFlowOutOfGrid = cel%rFlowOutOfGrid + rDelta
02132         cycle
02133       end if
02134 
02135       call Assert(LOGICAL(iTgt_Row>0 .and. iTgt_Row <= pGrd%iNY,kind=T_LOGICAL), 
02136         "iTgt_Row out of bounds: iRow= "//int2char(iRow)//"  iCol= "//int2char(iCol), 
02137         trim(__FILE__),__LINE__)
02138       call Assert(LOGICAL(iTgt_Col>0 .and. iTgt_Col <= pGrd%iNX,kind=T_LOGICAL), 
02139         "iTgt_Col out of bounds: iRow= "//int2char(iRow)//"  iCol= "//int2char(iCol), 
02140         trim(__FILE__),__LINE__)
02141 
02142       tcel => pGrd%Cells(iTgt_Row,iTgt_Col)
02143 
02144       if(tcel%iLandUse == pConfig%iOPEN_WATER_LU) then
02145 
02146           rDelta = rR - cel%rFlowOutOfGrid
02147           cel%rFlowOutOfGrid = cel%rFlowOutOfGrid + rDelta
02148 
02149       else  ! route water normally
02150 
02151           rDelta = rR - cel%rOutFlow
02152           tcel%rInFlow = tcel%rInFlow + rDelta
02153           cel%rOutFlow = cel%rOutFlow + rDelta
02154       end if
02155 
02156       ! Did we make a change?
02157       if ( rDelta > pConfig%rIterationTolerance ) then
02158         iCount = iCount+1
02159       end if
02160 
02161     end do
02162   end do
02163 
02164   return
02165 end function if_model_RunoffIteration
02166 
02167 !!***
02168 
02169 !--------------------------------------------------------------------------
02170 !!****f* model/rf_model_CellRunoff
02171 ! NAME
02172 !   rf_model_CellRunoff - Calculate runoff for a cell.
02173 !
02174 ! SYNOPSIS
02175 !   This subroutine determines the runoff (outflow) from a given cell
02176 !   by calling the appropriate runoff calculation function. Currently the
02177 !   function calls either a curve-number based runoff calculation function,
02178 !   or a Green-Ampt based runoff calculation function (unimplemented).
02179 !
02180 ! INPUTS
02181 !   pConfig - Pointer to the model configuration data structure.
02182 !   cel - Pointer to the grid cell for which runoff (outflow) calculation
02183 !         should occur.
02184 !   iDayOfYear - Integer value of the day number of the current year (1-366).
02185 !
02186 ! OUTPUTS
02187 !   rOutFlow - Runoff (outflow) value in inches.
02188 !
02189 ! SOURCE
02190 
02191 function rf_model_CellRunoff(pConfig, cel, iDayOfYear) result(rOutFlow)
02192   !! Calculates a single cell's runoff
02193   type (T_MODEL_CONFIGURATION), pointer :: pConfig ! pointer to data structure that contains
02194                                                    ! model options, flags, and other settings
02195   type (T_CELL),pointer :: cel
02196   integer (kind=T_INT),intent(in) :: iDayOfYear
02197   ! [ RETURN VALUE ]
02198   real (kind=T_SGL) :: rOutFlow
02199   ! [ LOCALS ]
02200 
02201   if (pConfig%iConfigureRunoff == CONFIG_RUNOFF_CURVE_NUMBER) then
02202     rOutFlow = runoff_CellRunoff_CurveNumber(pConfig, cel, iDayOfYear)
02203     call Assert(rOutFlow >= rZERO,"CN outflow is negative", &
02204       TRIM(__FILE__),__LINE__)
02205   else if (pConfig%iConfigureRunoff == CONFIG_RUNOFF_GREEN_AMPT) then
02206     rOutFlow = rf_model_CellRunoff_GreenAmpt(pConfig, cel, iDayOfYear)
02207     call Assert(rOutFlow >= rZERO,"Green-Ampt outflow is negative", &
02208       TRIM(__FILE__),__LINE__)
02209   end if
02210 
02211   return
02212 end function rf_model_CellRunoff
02213 
02214 !!***
02215 !--------------------------------------------------------------------------
02216 !!****f* model/rf_model_CellRunoff_GreenAmpt
02217 ! NAME
02218 !   rf_model_CellRunoff_GreenAmpt - Calculate runoff for a cell using a
02219 !      Green-Ampt based calculation method.
02220 !
02221 ! SYNOPSIS
02222 !   This function will (when implemented) return the value of runoff for
02223 !   the current grid cell based on a Green-Ampt based calculation method.
02224 !   The function currently throws an error if called.
02225 !
02226 ! INPUTS
02227 !   pConfig - Pointer to the model configuration data structure.
02228 !   cel - Pointer to the grid cell for which runoff (outflow) calculation
02229 !         should occur.
02230 !   iDayOfYear - Integer value of the day number of the current year (1-366).
02231 !
02232 ! OUTPUTS
02233 !   rOutFlow - Runoff (outflow) value in inches.
02234 !
02235 ! SOURCE
02236 
02237 function rf_model_CellRunoff_GreenAmpt(pConfig, cel, iDayOfYear) result(rOutFlow)
02238   !! Calculates a single cell's runoff using the modified Green-Ampt model
02239   type (T_MODEL_CONFIGURATION), pointer :: pConfig ! pointer to data structure that contains
02240                                                    ! model options, flags, and other settings
02241   type (T_CELL),pointer :: cel
02242   integer (kind=T_INT),intent(in) :: iDayOfYear
02243   ! [ RETURN VALUE ]
02244   real (kind=T_SGL) :: rOutFlow
02245   ! [ LOCALS ]
02246 
02247   call Assert( lFALSE, "Steve needs to put some code in here!" )
02248   !!!STEVE
02249   !!!PUT SINGLE_CELL G-A _RUNOFF_ CALCULATION IN HERE
02250 
02251   rOutFlow = -9999.
02252 
02253   return
02254 end function rf_model_CellRunoff_GreenAmpt
02255 
02256 !!***
02257 !--------------------------------------------------------------------------
02258 !!****s* model/model_InitializeFlowDirection
02259 ! NAME
02260 !   model_InitializeFlowDirection - Scans the flow direction grid for
02261 !     closed depressions and marks them.
02262 !
02263 ! SYNOPSIS
02264 !   This subroutine makes a single pass through the FLOW DIRECTION grid
02265 !   input and assigns flow directions to the model grid based on that
02266 !   input.  If the cyclic flow routing is detected (a => b; b => a),
02267 !   both cells will be marked as closed depressions.  If the target of the
02268 !   current grid cell is outside the model domain, the target cell is
02269 !   identified as having left the grid.
02270 !
02271 ! INPUTS
02272 !   pGrd - Pointer to the model grid data structure.
02273 !   pConfig - Pointer to the model configuration data structure.
02274 !
02275 ! OUTPUTS
02276 !   NONE
02277 !
02278 ! NOTES
02279 !   ** Code refers to parameters that are set within types.f95.
02280 !   ** Code directly modifies model grid values through the manipulation
02281 !       of pointers.
02282 !
02283 ! SOURCE
02284 
02285 subroutine model_InitializeFlowDirection( pGrd , pConfig)
02286   !! Scans the flow direction grid for closed depressions and marks them
02287   ! [ ARGUMENTS ]
02288   type ( T_GENERAL_GRID ),pointer :: pGrd         ! pointer to model grid
02289 
02290   type (T_MODEL_CONFIGURATION), pointer :: pConfig ! pointer to data structure that contains
02291                                                    ! model options, flags, and other settings
02292 
02293   integer (kind=T_INT) :: iRow,iCol
02294   integer (kind=T_INT) :: iTgt_Row,iTgt_Col
02295   ! [ PARAMETERS ]
02296   integer (kind=T_SHORT),parameter :: DIR_DEPRESSION=0
02297   integer (kind=T_SHORT),parameter :: DIR_RIGHT=1
02298   integer (kind=T_SHORT),parameter :: DIR_DOWN_RIGHT=2
02299   integer (kind=T_SHORT),parameter :: DIR_DOWN=4
02300   integer (kind=T_SHORT),parameter :: DIR_DOWN_LEFT=8
02301   integer (kind=T_SHORT),parameter :: DIR_LEFT=16
02302   integer (kind=T_SHORT),parameter :: DIR_UP_LEFT=32
02303   integer (kind=T_SHORT),parameter :: DIR_UP=64
02304   integer (kind=T_SHORT),parameter :: DIR_UP_RIGHT=128
02305   character (len=256) :: sBuf
02306 
02307   ! no point in doing these calculations unless we're really going to
02308   ! route water
02309   if(pConfig%iConfigureRunoffMode==CONFIG_RUNOFF_NO_ROUTING) return
02310 
02311   do iCol=1,pGrd%iNX
02312     do iRow=1,pGrd%iNY
02313 
02314       select case (pGrd%Cells(iRow,iCol)%iFlowDir)
02315         case ( DIR_DEPRESSION )
02316           iTgt_Col = iROUTE_DEPRESSION               ! added Jan 2009 SMW
02317           iTgt_Row = iROUTE_DEPRESSION               ! added Jan 2009 SMW
02318           continue
02319         case ( DIR_RIGHT )
02320           iTgt_Row = iRow
02321           iTgt_Col = iCol+1
02322           if ( iTgt_Row >= 1 .and. iTgt_Row <= pGrd%iNY .and. &
02323                iTgt_Col >= 1 .and. iTgt_Col <= pGrd%iNX ) then
02324             if ( pGrd%Cells(iTgt_Row,iTgt_Col)%iFlowDir == DIR_LEFT ) then
02325               pGrd%Cells(iRow,iCol)%iFlowDir = DIR_DEPRESSION
02326               pGrd%Cells(iTgt_Row,iTgt_Col)%iFlowDir = DIR_DEPRESSION
02327               write(UNIT=LU_LOG,FMT=*) 'depression found in cell (row, col): ',iRow,iCol
02328             end if
02329           end if
02330         case ( DIR_DOWN_RIGHT )
02331           iTgt_Row = iRow+1
02332           iTgt_Col = iCol+1
02333           if ( iTgt_Row >= 1 .and. iTgt_Row <= pGrd%iNY .and. &
02334                iTgt_Col >= 1 .and. iTgt_Col <= pGrd%iNX ) then
02335             if ( pGrd%Cells(iTgt_Row,iTgt_Col)%iFlowDir == DIR_UP_LEFT ) then
02336               pGrd%Cells(iRow,iCol)%iFlowDir = DIR_DEPRESSION
02337               pGrd%Cells(iTgt_Row,iTgt_Col)%iFlowDir = DIR_DEPRESSION
02338               write(UNIT=LU_LOG,FMT=*) 'depression found in cell (row, col): ',iRow,iCol
02339             end if
02340           end if
02341         case ( DIR_DOWN )
02342           iTgt_Row = iRow+1
02343           iTgt_Col = iCol
02344           if ( iTgt_Row >= 1 .and. iTgt_Row <= pGrd%iNY .and. &
02345                iTgt_Col >= 1 .and. iTgt_Col <= pGrd%iNX ) then
02346             if ( pGrd%Cells(iTgt_Row,iTgt_Col)%iFlowDir == DIR_UP ) then
02347               pGrd%Cells(iRow,iCol)%iFlowDir = DIR_DEPRESSION
02348               pGrd%Cells(iTgt_Row,iTgt_Col)%iFlowDir = DIR_DEPRESSION
02349               write(UNIT=LU_LOG,FMT=*) 'depression found in cell (row, col): ',iRow,iCol
02350             end if
02351           end if
02352         case ( DIR_DOWN_LEFT )
02353           iTgt_Row = iRow+1
02354           iTgt_Col = iCol-1
02355           if ( iTgt_Row >= 1 .and. iTgt_Row <= pGrd%iNY .and. &
02356                iTgt_Col >= 1 .and. iTgt_Col <= pGrd%iNX ) then
02357             if ( pGrd%Cells(iTgt_Row,iTgt_Col)%iFlowDir == DIR_UP_RIGHT ) then
02358               pGrd%Cells(iRow,iCol)%iFlowDir = DIR_DEPRESSION
02359               pGrd%Cells(iTgt_Row,iTgt_Col)%iFlowDir = DIR_DEPRESSION
02360               write(UNIT=LU_LOG,FMT=*) 'depression found in cell (row, col): ',iRow,iCol
02361             end if
02362           end if
02363         case ( DIR_LEFT )
02364           iTgt_Row = iRow
02365           iTgt_Col = iCol-1
02366           if ( iTgt_Row >= 1 .and. iTgt_Row <= pGrd%iNY .and. &
02367                iTgt_Col >= 1 .and. iTgt_Col <= pGrd%iNX ) then
02368             if ( pGrd%Cells(iTgt_Row,iTgt_Col)%iFlowDir == DIR_RIGHT) then
02369               pGrd%Cells(iRow,iCol)%iFlowDir = DIR_DEPRESSION
02370               pGrd%Cells(iTgt_Row,iTgt_Col)%iFlowDir = DIR_DEPRESSION
02371               write(UNIT=LU_LOG,FMT=*) 'depression found in cell (row, col): ',iRow,iCol
02372             end if
02373           end if
02374         case ( DIR_UP_LEFT )
02375           iTgt_Row = iRow-1
02376           iTgt_Col = iCol-1
02377           if ( iTgt_Row >= 1 .and. iTgt_Row <= pGrd%iNY .and. &
02378                iTgt_Col >= 1 .and. iTgt_Col <= pGrd%iNX ) then
02379             if ( pGrd%Cells(iTgt_Row,iTgt_Col)%iFlowDir == DIR_DOWN_RIGHT) then
02380               pGrd%Cells(iRow,iCol)%iFlowDir = DIR_DEPRESSION
02381               pGrd%Cells(iTgt_Row,iTgt_Col)%iFlowDir = DIR_DEPRESSION
02382               write(UNIT=LU_LOG,FMT=*) 'depression found in cell (row, col): ',iRow,iCol
02383             end if
02384           end if
02385         case ( DIR_UP )
02386           iTgt_Row = iRow-1
02387           iTgt_Col = iCol
02388           if ( iTgt_Row >= 1 .and. iTgt_Row <= pGrd%iNY .and. &
02389                iTgt_Col >= 1 .and. iTgt_Col <= pGrd%iNX ) then
02390             if ( pGrd%Cells(iTgt_Row,iTgt_Col)%iFlowDir == DIR_DOWN) then
02391               pGrd%Cells(iRow,iCol)%iFlowDir = DIR_DEPRESSION
02392               pGrd%Cells(iTgt_Row,iTgt_Col)%iFlowDir = DIR_DEPRESSION
02393               write(UNIT=LU_LOG,FMT=*) 'depression found in cell (row, col): ',iRow,iCol
02394             end if
02395           end if
02396         case ( DIR_UP_RIGHT )
02397           iTgt_Row = iRow-1
02398           iTgt_Col = iCol+1
02399           if ( iTgt_Row >= 1 .and. iTgt_Row <= pGrd%iNY .and. &
02400                iTgt_Col >= 1 .and. iTgt_Col <= pGrd%iNX ) then
02401             if ( pGrd%Cells(iTgt_Row,iTgt_Col)%iFlowDir == DIR_DOWN_LEFT) then
02402               pGrd%Cells(iRow,iCol)%iFlowDir = DIR_DEPRESSION
02403               pGrd%Cells(iTgt_Row,iTgt_Col)%iFlowDir = DIR_DEPRESSION
02404               write(UNIT=LU_LOG,FMT=*) 'depression found in cell (row, col): ',iRow,iCol
02405             end if
02406           end if
02407         case default  !! flow direction indeterminate
02408         !!
02409         !!  NOTE: This may not be the correct way to deal with indeterminate
02410         !!        flow directions!!
02411         !!
02412           write ( unit=sBuf, fmt='("Flow direction grid element (",i3,",",i3,' &
02413              // '") contains undefined flow direction with integer value: ",i4)' ) &
02414                    iCol,iRow,pGrd%Cells(iRow,iCol)%iFlowDir
02415           write(UNIT=LU_LOG,FMT=*)  sBuf
02416           pGrd%Cells(iRow,iCol)%iFlowDir = DIR_DEPRESSION
02417           iTgt_Col = iROUTE_DEPRESSION
02418           iTgt_Row = iROUTE_DEPRESSION
02419       end select
02420 
02421       ! does the current value of either target point outside of the grid?
02422       if ( iTgt_Row == 0 .or. iTgt_Row > pGrd%iNY .or. &
02423        iTgt_Col == 0 .or. iTgt_Col > pGrd%iNX ) then
02424          iTgt_Row = iROUTE_LEFT_GRID
02425          iTgt_Col = iROUTE_LEFT_GRID
02426       end if
02427 
02428       ! now assign the value of the targets to the iTgt element of the
02429       ! grid data structure
02430       pGrd%Cells(iRow,iCol)%iTgt_Row = iTgt_Col
02431       pGrd%Cells(iRow,iCol)%iTgt_Col = iTgt_Row
02432     end do
02433   end do
02434 
02435 #ifdef DEBUG_PRINT
02436 
02437   do iCol=1,pGrd%iNX
02438     do iRow=1,pGrd%iNY
02439       if(pGrd%Cells(iRow,iCol)%iTgt_Col==iCol .and. pGrd%Cells(iRow,iCol)%iTgt_Row==iRow) then
02440        write(unit=LU_LOG,FMT=*) 'ALERT** target is the same as the originating cell'
02441        write(unit=LU_LOG,FMT=*) '  ORIG   (iRow, iCol) : ',iRow, iCol
02442        write(unit=LU_LOG,FMT=*) '  ==> FLOWDIR: ',pGrd%Cells(iRow,iCol)%iFlowDir
02443        write(unit=LU_LOG,FMT=*) '  TARGET (iRow, iCol) : ',pGrd%Cells(iRow,iCol)%iTgt_Row, &
02444          pGrd%Cells(iRow,iCol)%iTgt_Col
02445        write(unit=LU_LOG,FMT=*) '  ==> FLOWDIR: ' , &
02446          pGrd%Cells(pGrd%Cells(iRow,iCol)%iTgt_Row,pGrd%Cells(iRow,iCol)%iTgt_Col)%iFlowDir
02447       end if
02448     end do
02449  end do
02450 
02451 #endif
02452 
02453   return
02454 end subroutine model_InitializeFlowDirection
02455 
02456 !!***
02457 
02458 !--------------------------------------------------------------------------
02459 
02460 subroutine model_DownstreamCell(pGrd,iRow,iCol,iTgt_Row,iTgt_Col)
02461   !! Determines the "downstream" cell for cell (iRow,iCol) and returns the index in
02462   !! (iTgt_Row,iTgt_Col)
02463   ! [ ARGUMENTS ]
02464   type ( T_GENERAL_GRID ),pointer :: pGrd        ! pointer to model grid
02465   integer (kind=T_INT),intent(in) :: iRow,iCol
02466   integer (kind=T_INT),intent(out) :: iTgt_Row,iTgt_Col
02467   ! [ PARAMETERS ]
02468   integer (kind=T_SHORT),parameter :: DIR_DEPRESSION=0
02469   integer (kind=T_SHORT),parameter :: DIR_RIGHT=1
02470   integer (kind=T_SHORT),parameter :: DIR_DOWN_RIGHT=2
02471   integer (kind=T_SHORT),parameter :: DIR_DOWN=4
02472   integer (kind=T_SHORT),parameter :: DIR_DOWN_LEFT=8
02473   integer (kind=T_SHORT),parameter :: DIR_LEFT=16
02474   integer (kind=T_SHORT),parameter :: DIR_UP_LEFT=32
02475   integer (kind=T_SHORT),parameter :: DIR_UP=64
02476   integer (kind=T_SHORT),parameter :: DIR_UP_RIGHT=128
02477 
02478   select case (pGrd%Cells(iRow,iCol)%iFlowDir)
02479     case ( DIR_DEPRESSION )
02480       iTgt_Row = iROUTE_DEPRESSION  ! value is -999
02481       iTgt_Col = iROUTE_DEPRESSION  ! value is -999
02482     case ( DIR_RIGHT )
02483       iTgt_Row = iRow
02484       iTgt_Col = iCol+1
02485     case ( DIR_DOWN_RIGHT )
02486       iTgt_Row = iRow+1
02487       iTgt_Col = iCol+1
02488     case ( DIR_DOWN )
02489       iTgt_Row = iRow+1
02490       iTgt_Col = iCol
02491     case ( DIR_DOWN_LEFT )
02492       iTgt_Row = iRow+1
02493       iTgt_Col = iCol-1
02494     case ( DIR_LEFT )
02495       iTgt_Row = iRow
02496       iTgt_Col = iCol-1
02497     case ( DIR_UP_LEFT )
02498       iTgt_Row = iRow-1
02499       iTgt_Col = iCol-1
02500     case ( DIR_UP )
02501       iTgt_Row = iRow-1
02502       iTgt_Col = iCol
02503     case ( DIR_UP_RIGHT )
02504       iTgt_Row = iRow-1
02505       iTgt_Col = iCol+1
02506   end select
02507 
02508   ! the following code was trapping all 'iROUTE_DEPRESSION' values and
02509   ! converting them to iROUTE_LEFT_GRID values
02510   !
02511   ! changed test from "iTgt_Row < 1" to "iTgt_Row == 0"
02512 
02513   if ( iTgt_Row == 0 .or. iTgt_Row > pGrd%iNY .or. &
02514        iTgt_Col == 0 .or. iTgt_Col > pGrd%iNX ) then    ! Left the grid?
02515     iTgt_Row = iROUTE_LEFT_GRID
02516     iTgt_Col = iROUTE_LEFT_GRID
02517   end if
02518 
02519   return
02520 end subroutine model_DownstreamCell
02521 
02522 !--------------------------------------------------------------------------
02523 
02524 subroutine model_ReadBasinMaskTable ( pConfig )
02525   !! reads the basin cacthment data file for subsequent processing
02526   type (T_MODEL_CONFIGURATION), pointer :: pConfig ! pointer to data structure that contains
02527                                                    ! model options, flags, and other settings
02528   ! [ LOCALS ]
02529   integer (kind=T_INT) :: iStat, iNumMaskFiles, i, iRecNum, iSize
02530   character (len=256) :: sRecord                  ! Input file text buffer
02531   character (len=256) :: sItem                    ! Key word read from sRecord
02532   character (len=256) :: sBuf
02533 
02534   ! open basin mask file
02535   open ( unit=LU_MASK, file=pConfig%sBasinMaskFilename, &
02536             status="OLD", iostat=iStat )
02537   call Assert( LOGICAL( iStat == 0,kind=T_LOGICAL), 
02538             "Open failed for file: " // pConfig%sBasinMaskFilename )
02539 
02540   ! read first line of file
02541   read ( unit=LU_MASK, fmt="(a256)", iostat=iStat ) sRecord
02542   call Assert( iStat == 0, &
02543      "Error reading first line of basin mask table" )
02544 
02545   ! read mask file to obtain expected number of basin mask files
02546   call Chomp_tab( sRecord, sItem )
02547   call Uppercase( sItem )
02548   if ( sItem == "NUM_BASIN_MASK_FILES" ) then
02549     call Chomp_tab ( sRecord, sItem )
02550     read ( unit=sItem, fmt=*, iostat=iStat ) iNumMaskFiles
02551     call Assert( iStat == 0, "Failed to read number of basin mask files" )
02552     write(UNIT=LU_LOG,FMT=*)  "==> allocating memory for",iNumMaskFiles, &
02553        " landuse types within basin mask table"
02554   else
02555     call Assert( lFALSE, &
02556        "Unknown option in basin mask table; was expecting NUM_BASIN_MASK_FILES #")
02557   end if
02558 
02559   ! read (AND IGNORE) second line of file
02560   read ( unit=LU_MASK, fmt="(a256)", iostat=iStat ) sRecord
02561   call Assert( iStat == 0, &
02562      "Error reading second line of basin mask table" )
02563 
02564   ! now allocate memory for BASIN MASK table
02565   allocate ( pConfig%BMASK( iNumMaskFiles ), stat=iStat )
02566   call Assert ( iStat == 0, &
02567     "Could not allocate space for basin mask data structure" )
02568 
02569   iSize = size(pConfig%BMASK,1)
02570 
02571   iRecNum = 1
02572 
02573   BMASK: do
02574 
02575     read ( unit=LU_MASK, fmt="(a256)", iostat=iStat ) sRecord
02576     if ( iStat < 0 ) exit     ! EOF mark
02577     if ( sRecord(1:1) == "#" ) cycle      ! Ignore comment lines
02578 
02579     if(iRecNum > iSize) then
02580       write(UNIT=LU_LOG,FMT=*) ""
02581       write(UNIT=LU_LOG,FMT=*)  " *** The maximum number of basin mask table elements has"
02582       write(UNIT=LU_LOG,FMT=*)  "     been read in before reaching the end of the file."
02583       write(UNIT=LU_LOG,FMT=*) ""
02584       write(UNIT=LU_LOG,FMT=*)  "     size of allocated memory for BASIN MASK table: ",iSize
02585       write(UNIT=LU_LOG,FMT=*)  "     current record number: ", iRecNum
02586       exit
02587     end if
02588 
02589     write(UNIT=LU_LOG,FMT=*) ""
02590     write(UNIT=LU_LOG,FMT=*)  "-----------------------------------------------------------"
02591     write(UNIT=LU_LOG,FMT=*)  "Reading basin mask record number ",iRecNum, " of ",iNumMaskFiles
02592     write(UNIT=LU_LOG,FMT=*) ""
02593 
02594     call Chomp_tab ( sRecord, sItem )
02595     read ( unit=sItem, fmt=*, iostat=iStat ) pConfig%BMASK(iRecNum)%sUSGS_UpstreamOrderID
02596     call Assert( iStat == 0, &
02597       "Error reading upstream order ID in basin mask table" )
02598     write(UNIT=LU_LOG,FMT=*)  "Upstream order ID = ",TRIM(pConfig%BMASK(iRecNum)%sUSGS_UpstreamOrderID)
02599 
02600     call Chomp_tab ( sRecord, sItem )
02601     call Uppercase(sItem)
02602     pConfig%BMASK(iRecNum)%sBasinDescription = TRIM(sItem)
02603     call Assert( iStat == 0, &
02604       "Error reading basin description in basin mask table" )
02605     write(UNIT=LU_LOG,FMT=*)  "Basin description = ",TRIM(pConfig%BMASK(iRecNum)%sBasinDescription)
02606 
02607     call Chomp_tab ( sRecord, sItem )
02608     pConfig%BMASK(iRecNum)%sPestGroup = TRIM(ADJUSTL(sItem))
02609     call Assert( iStat == 0, &
02610       "Error reading PEST group in basin mask table" )
02611     write(UNIT=LU_LOG,FMT=*)  "PEST group = ",TRIM(pConfig%BMASK(iRecNum)%sPestGroup)
02612 
02613     call Chomp_tab ( sRecord, sItem )
02614     read ( unit=sItem, fmt=*, iostat=iStat ) pConfig%BMASK(iRecNum)%rPestWeight
02615     call Assert( iStat == 0, &
02616       "Error reading PEST observation weight in basin mask table" )
02617     write(sBuf,FMT="(F12.3)") pConfig%BMASK(iRecNum)%rPestWeight
02618     write(UNIT=LU_LOG,FMT=*)  "PEST weight = "//TRIM(sBuf)
02619 
02620     call Chomp_tab ( sRecord, sItem )
02621 !    read ( unit=sItem, fmt=*, iostat=iStat ) pConfig%BMASK(iRecNum)%sBasinMaskFilename
02622     pConfig%BMASK(iRecNum)%sBasinMaskFilename = TRIM(ADJUSTL(sItem))
02623     call Assert( iStat == 0, &
02624       "Error reading basin mask filename in basin mask table" )
02625     write(UNIT=LU_LOG,FMT=*)  "Basin mask filename = ",TRIM(pConfig%BMASK(iRecNum)%sBasinMaskFilename)
02626 
02627     call Chomp_tab ( sRecord, sItem )
02628     read ( unit=sItem, fmt=*, iostat=iStat ) pConfig%BMASK(iRecNum)%sFileType
02629     call Assert( iStat == 0, &
02630       "Error reading basin mask file type in basin mask table" )
02631     write(UNIT=LU_LOG,FMT=*)  "Basin mask filetype = ",TRIM(pConfig%BMASK(iRecNum)%sFileType)
02632 
02633     call Chomp_tab ( sRecord, sItem )
02634     read ( unit=sItem, fmt=*, iostat=iStat ) pConfig%BMASK(iRecNum)%rQb
02635     call Assert( iStat == 0, &
02636       "Error reading baseflow estimate Qb in basin mask table" )
02637     write(UNIT=LU_LOG,FMT=*)  "Qb = ",pConfig%BMASK(iRecNum)%rQb
02638 
02639     call Chomp_tab ( sRecord, sItem )
02640     read ( unit=sItem, fmt=*, iostat=iStat ) pConfig%BMASK(iRecNum)%rDrainageArea
02641     call Assert( iStat == 0, &
02642       "Error reading basin drainage area in basin mask table" )
02643     write(UNIT=LU_LOG,FMT=*)  "Drainage area = ", &
02644         pConfig%BMASK(iRecNum)%rDrainageArea
02645 
02646     iRecNum = iRecNum + 1
02647 
02648   end do BMASK
02649 
02650   flush(UNIT=LU_LOG)
02651 
02652 end subroutine model_ReadBasinMaskTable
02653 
02654 !--------------------------------------------------------------------------
02655 
02656 subroutine model_ReadLanduseLookupTable( pConfig )
02657   !! Reads the landuse data from pConfig%sLanduseLookupFilename
02658   ! [ ARGUMENTS ]
02659   type (T_MODEL_CONFIGURATION), pointer :: pConfig ! pointer to data structure that contains
02660                                                    ! model options, flags, and other settings
02661   ! [ LOCALS ]
02662   integer (kind=T_INT) :: iStat, iNumLandUses, i, iType, iRecNum, iSize
02663   integer (kind=T_INT) :: iNumSoilTypes
02664   character (len=1024) :: sRecord                  ! Input file text buffer
02665   character (len=256) :: sItem                    ! Key word read from sRecord
02666 
02667   ! open landuse file
02668   open ( unit=LU_LOOKUP, file=pConfig%sLanduseLookupFilename, &
02669             status="OLD", iostat=iStat )
02670   call Assert( LOGICAL( iStat == 0,kind=T_LOGICAL), 
02671             "Open failed for file: " // pConfig%sLanduseLookupFilename )
02672 
02673   ! read first line of file
02674   read ( unit=LU_LOOKUP, fmt="(a)", iostat=iStat ) sRecord
02675   call Assert( iStat == 0, &
02676      "Error reading first line of landuse lookup table" )
02677 
02678   ! read landuse file to obtain expected number of landuse types
02679   call Chomp_tab( sRecord, sItem )
02680   call Uppercase( sItem )
02681   if ( sItem == "NUM_LANDUSE_TYPES" ) then
02682     call Chomp_tab ( sRecord, sItem )
02683     read ( unit=sItem, fmt=*, iostat=iStat ) iNumLandUses
02684     call Assert( iStat == 0, "Failed to read number of landuse types" )
02685     write(UNIT=LU_LOG,FMT=*)  "==> allocating memory for",iNumLandUses,"landuse types within lookup table"
02686   else
02687     call Assert( lFALSE, &
02688        "Unknown option in landuse lookup table; was expecting NUM_LANDUSE_TYPES #")
02689   end if
02690 
02691   ! read second line of file
02692   read ( unit=LU_LOOKUP, fmt="(a)", iostat=iStat ) sRecord
02693   call Assert( iStat == 0, &
02694      "Error reading second line of landuse lookup table" )
02695 
02696   ! read landuse file to obtain expected number of soil types
02697   call Chomp_tab( sRecord, sItem )
02698   call Uppercase( sItem )
02699   if ( sItem == "NUM_SOIL_TYPES" ) then
02700     call Chomp_tab ( sRecord, sItem )
02701     read ( unit=sItem, fmt=*, iostat=iStat ) iNumSoilTypes
02702     call Assert( iStat == 0, "Failed to read number of soil types" )
02703     write(UNIT=LU_LOG,FMT=*)  "==> allocating memory for",iNumSoilTypes,"soil types within lookup table"
02704   else
02705     call Assert( lFALSE, &
02706        "Unknown option in landuse lookup table; was expecting NUM_SOIL_TYPES #")
02707   end if
02708 
02709   ! now allocate memory for landuse table
02710   allocate ( pConfig%LU( iNumLandUses ), stat=iStat )
02711   call Assert ( iStat == 0, &
02712     "Could not allocate space for landuse data structure" )
02713 
02714   iSize = size(pConfig%LU,1)
02715 
02716   ! now allocate memory for SOILS subtable within landuse table
02717   allocate ( pConfig%CN( iNumLandUses,iNumSoilTypes ), stat=iStat )
02718   call Assert ( iStat == 0, &
02719     "Could not allocate space for CN subtable within landuse data structure" )
02720 
02721   ! now allocate memory for ROOTING DEPTH subtable within landuse table
02722   allocate ( pConfig%ROOTING_DEPTH( iNumLandUses,iNumSoilTypes ), stat=iStat )
02723   call Assert ( iStat == 0, &
02724     "Could not allocate space for ROOTING_DEPTH subtable within landuse data structure" )
02725 
02726   ! now allocate memory for MAX_RECHARGE subtable within landuse table
02727   allocate ( pConfig%MAX_RECHARGE( iNumLandUses,iNumSoilTypes ), stat=iStat )
02728   call Assert ( iStat == 0, &
02729     "Could not allocate space for MAX_RECHARGE subtable within landuse data structure" )
02730 
02731   ! now allocate memory for IRRIGATION subtable within landuse table
02732   ! note that this table is NOT populated in this subroutine, but in "readIrrgationLookupTable"
02733   allocate ( pConfig%IRRIGATION( iNumLandUses ), stat=iStat )
02734   call Assert ( iStat == 0, &
02735     "Could not allocate space for IRRIGATION data structure" )
02736 
02737   iRecNum = 1
02738 
02739   LU_READ: do
02740 
02741     read ( unit=LU_LOOKUP, fmt="(a)", iostat=iStat ) sRecord
02742     if ( iStat < 0 ) exit     ! EOF mark
02743     if ( sRecord(1:1) == "#" ) cycle      ! Ignore comment lines
02744 
02745     if(iRecNum > iSize) then
02746       write(UNIT=LU_LOG,FMT=*) ""
02747       write(UNIT=LU_LOG,FMT=*)  " *** The maximum number of landuse lookup table elements has"
02748       write(UNIT=LU_LOG,FMT=*)  "     been read in before reaching the end of the file."
02749       write(UNIT=LU_LOG,FMT=*) ""
02750       write(UNIT=LU_LOG,FMT=*)  "     size of allocated memory for LU table: ",iSize
02751       write(UNIT=LU_LOG,FMT=*)  "     current record number: ", iRecNum
02752       exit
02753     end if
02754 
02755     write(UNIT=LU_LOG,FMT=*) ""
02756     write(UNIT=LU_LOG,FMT=*)  "-----------------------------------------------------------"
02757     write(UNIT=LU_LOG,FMT=*)  "Reading landuse record number ",iRecNum, " of ",iNumLandUses
02758     write(UNIT=LU_LOG,FMT=*) ""
02759 
02760     call Chomp_tab ( sRecord, sItem )
02761     read ( unit=sItem, fmt=*, iostat=iStat ) pConfig%LU(iRecNum)%iLandUseType
02762     call Assert( iStat == 0, "Error reading land use type in landuse lookup table" )
02763     write(UNIT=LU_LOG,FMT=*)  "  landuse type = ",pConfig%LU(iRecNum)%iLandUseType
02764 
02765     call Chomp_tab ( sRecord, pConfig%LU(iRecNum)%sLandUseDescription )
02766     write(UNIT=LU_LOG,FMT=*)  "  landuse description = ", &
02767       TRIM(pConfig%LU(iRecNum)%sLandUseDescription)
02768 
02769     call Chomp_tab ( sRecord, pConfig%LU(iRecNum)%sAssumedPercentImperviousness )
02770     write(UNIT=LU_LOG,FMT=*)  "  assumed % imperviousness = ", &
02771       TRIM(pConfig%LU(iRecNum)%sAssumedPercentImperviousness)
02772 
02773     do i=1,iNumSoilTypes
02774       call Chomp_tab ( sRecord, sItem )
02775       read ( unit=sItem, fmt=*, iostat=iStat ) pConfig%CN(iRecNum,i)
02776       call Assert( iStat == 0, &
02777         "Error reading curve number for soil group in landuse lookup table" )
02778       write(UNIT=LU_LOG,FMT=*)  "  curve number for soil group",i,": ",pConfig%CN(iRecNum,i)
02779     end do
02780 
02781     do i=1,iNumSoilTypes
02782       call Chomp_tab ( sRecord, sItem )
02783       read ( unit=sItem, fmt=*, iostat=iStat ) pConfig%MAX_RECHARGE(iRecNum,i)
02784       call Assert( iStat == 0, &
02785         "Error reading maximum recharge for soil group in landuse lookup table" )
02786       write(UNIT=LU_LOG,FMT=*)  "  MAXIMUM RECHARGE for soil group",i,": ",pConfig%MAX_RECHARGE(iRecNum,i)
02787     end do
02788 
02789     call Chomp_tab ( sRecord, sItem )
02790     read ( unit=sItem, fmt=*, iostat=iStat ) pConfig%LU(iRecNum)%rIntercept_GrowingSeason
02791     call Assert( iStat == 0, "Error reading interception values in landuse file" )
02792     write(UNIT=LU_LOG,FMT=*)  "  Interception value for growing season = ",pConfig%LU(iRecNum)%rIntercept_GrowingSeason
02793 
02794     call Chomp_tab ( sRecord, sItem )
02795    read ( unit=sItem, fmt=*, iostat=iStat ) pConfig%LU(iRecNum)%rIntercept_NonGrowingSeason
02796     call Assert( iStat == 0, "Error reading interception values in landuse file" )
02797     write(UNIT=LU_LOG,FMT=*)  "  Interception value for non-growing season = ", &
02798         pConfig%LU(iRecNum)%rIntercept_NonGrowingSeason
02799 
02800     ! now read in a rooting depth for each landuse/soil type combination
02801     do i=1,iNumSoilTypes
02802       call Chomp_tab ( sRecord, sItem )
02803       read ( unit=sItem, fmt=*, iostat=iStat ) pConfig%ROOTING_DEPTH(iRecNum,i)
02804       call Assert( iStat == 0, &
02805         "Error reading rooting depth for soil group in landuse lookup table" )
02806       write(UNIT=LU_LOG,FMT=*)  "  ROOTING DEPTH for soil group",i,": ",pConfig%ROOTING_DEPTH(iRecNum,i)
02807     end do
02808 
02809 !    call Chomp_tab ( sRecord, sItem )
02810 !    read ( unit=sItem, fmt=*, iostat=iStat ) pConfig%LU(iRecNum)%lCONSTANT_ROOT_ZONE_DEPTH
02811 !    call Assert( iStat == 0, "Error reading root-zone depth constant in landuse file" )
02812 !    write(UNIT=LU_LOG,FMT=*)  "  Root zone treated as a constant value?  ", &
02813 !        pConfig%LU(iRecNum)%lCONSTANT_ROOT_ZONE_DEPTH
02814 
02815 !    do i=1,iNUM_ROOT_ZONE_PAIRS
02816 !
02817 !      call Chomp_tab ( sRecord, sItem )
02818 !      read ( unit=sItem, fmt=*, iostat=iStat ) pConfig%LU(iRecNum)%rX_ROOT_ZONE(i)
02819 !      call Assert( iStat == 0, &
02820 !       "Error reading root zone X value number in landuse file" )
02821 !      write(UNIT=LU_LOG,FMT=*)  "    Root zone available water capacity (in/ft): X(",i,") = ", &
02822 !          pConfig%LU(iRecNum)%rX_ROOT_ZONE(i)
02823 !
02824 !    end do
02825 !
02826 !    do i=1,iNUM_ROOT_ZONE_PAIRS
02827 !
02828 !      call Chomp_tab ( sRecord, sItem )
02829 !      read ( unit=sItem, fmt=*, iostat=iStat ) pConfig%LU(iRecNum)%rY_ROOT_ZONE(i)
02830 !      call Assert( iStat == 0, "Error reading root zone Y values in landuse file" )
02831 !      write(UNIT=LU_LOG,FMT=*)  "    Root zone root zone depth (ft):             Y(",i,") = ", &
02832 !          pConfig%LU(iRecNum)%rY_ROOT_ZONE(i)
02833 !
02834 !    end do
02835 
02836     iRecNum = iRecNum + 1
02837 
02838   end do LU_READ
02839 
02840   pConfig%IRRIGATION%iLandUseType = pConfig%LU%iLandUseType
02841 
02842   ! That's all!
02843   close ( unit=LU_LOOKUP )
02844 
02845   return
02846 end subroutine model_ReadLanduseLookupTable
02847 
02848 !--------------------------------------------------------------------------
02849 
02850 #ifdef IRRIGATION_MODULE
02851 
02852 subroutine model_ReadIrrigationLookupTable( pConfig )
02853   !! Reads the irrigation data from pConfig%sIrrigationLookupFilename
02854   ! [ ARGUMENTS ]
02855   type (T_MODEL_CONFIGURATION), pointer :: pConfig ! pointer to data structure that contains
02856                                                    ! model options, flags, and other settings
02857   ! [ LOCALS ]
02858   integer (kind=T_INT) :: iStat, iNumLandUses, i, iType, iRecNum, iSize
02859   integer (kind=T_INT) :: iLandUseType
02860   integer (kind=T_INT) :: iNumSoilTypes
02861   character (len=1024) :: sRecord                  ! Input file text buffer
02862   character (len=256) :: sItem                    ! Key word read from sRecord
02863 
02864   ! open landuse file
02865   open ( unit=LU_LOOKUP, file=pConfig%sIrrigationLookupFilename, &
02866             status="OLD", iostat=iStat )
02867   call Assert( LOGICAL( iStat == 0,kind=T_LOGICAL), 
02868             "Open failed for file: " // pConfig%sIrrigationLookupFilename )
02869 
02870   ! read first line of file
02871   read ( unit=LU_LOOKUP, fmt="(a)", iostat=iStat ) sRecord
02872   call Assert( iStat == 0, &
02873      "Error reading first line of irrigation lookup table" )
02874 
02875   ! read landuse file to obtain expected number of landuse types
02876   call Chomp_tab( sRecord, sItem )
02877   call Uppercase( sItem )
02878   if ( sItem == "NUM_LANDUSE_TYPES" ) then
02879     call Chomp_tab ( sRecord, sItem )
02880     read ( unit=sItem, fmt=*, iostat=iStat ) iNumLandUses
02881     call Assert( iStat == 0, "Failed to read number of landuse types" )
02882     call Assert(iNumLandUses == size(pConfig%IRRIGATION), &
02883         "Number of landuses in IRRIGATION table is unequal to number in LANDUSE lookup table", &
02884         trim(__FILE__),__LINE__)
02885     write(UNIT=LU_LOG,FMT=*)  "==> allocating memory for",iNumLandUses,"landuse types within lookup table"
02886   else
02887     call Assert( lFALSE, &
02888        "Unknown option in irrigation lookup table; was expecting NUM_LANDUSE_TYPES #")
02889   end if
02890 
02891   call Assert(associated(pConfig%LU), "The landuse lookup table must be read in " &
02892     //"before the irrigation lookup table may be read.", trim(__FILE__),__LINE__)
02893 
02894   iSize = size(pConfig%LU,1)
02895 
02896   iRecNum = 1
02897 
02898   LU_READ: do
02899 
02900     read ( unit=LU_LOOKUP, fmt="(a)", iostat=iStat ) sRecord
02901     if ( iStat < 0 ) exit     ! EOF mark
02902     if ( sRecord(1:1) == "#" ) cycle      ! Ignore comment lines
02903 
02904     if(iRecNum > iSize) then
02905       write(UNIT=LU_LOG,FMT=*) ""
02906       write(UNIT=LU_LOG,FMT=*)  " *** The maximum number of irrigation lookup table elements has"
02907       write(UNIT=LU_LOG,FMT=*)  "     been read in before reaching the end of the file."
02908       write(UNIT=LU_LOG,FMT=*) ""
02909       write(UNIT=LU_LOG,FMT=*)  "     size of allocated memory for IRRIGATION table: ",iSize
02910       write(UNIT=LU_LOG,FMT=*)  "     current record number: ", iRecNum
02911       exit
02912     end if
02913 
02914     write(UNIT=LU_LOG,FMT=*) ""
02915     write(UNIT=LU_LOG,FMT=*)  "-----------------------------------------------------------"
02916     write(UNIT=LU_LOG,FMT=*)  "Reading irrigation table record number ",iRecNum, " of ",iNumLandUses
02917     write(UNIT=LU_LOG,FMT=*) ""
02918 
02919     call Chomp_tab ( sRecord, sItem )
02920     read ( unit=sItem, fmt=*, iostat=iStat ) iLandUseType
02921     call Assert( iStat == 0, "Error reading land use type in irrigation lookup table" )
02922     call Assert(iLandUseType == pConfig%LU(iRecNum)%iLandUseType, &
02923       "Landuse types in the irrigation lookup table must match those in the landuse lookup table", &
02924         trim(__FILE__), __LINE__)
02925     pConfig%IRRIGATION(iRecNum)%iLandUseType = iLandUseType
02926 
02927     call Chomp_tab ( sRecord, sItem )
02928     read ( unit=sItem, fmt=*, iostat=iStat ) pConfig%IRRIGATION(iRecNum)%rKc_Max
02929     call Assert( iStat == 0, &
02930       "Error reading maximum crop coefficient in irrigation lookup table" )
02931     write(UNIT=LU_LOG,FMT=*)  "  maximum crop coefficient ", &
02932         pConfig%IRRIGATION(iRecNum)%rKc_Max
02933 
02934     call Chomp_tab ( sRecord, sItem )
02935     read ( unit=sItem, fmt=*, iostat=iStat ) pConfig%IRRIGATION(iRecNum)%rK0
02936     call Assert( iStat == 0, &
02937       "Error reading first phenological stage crop coefficient in irrigation lookup table" )
02938     write(UNIT=LU_LOG,FMT=*)  "   first phenological stage crop coefficient ", &
02939         pConfig%IRRIGATION(iRecNum)%rK0
02940 
02941     call Chomp_tab ( sRecord, sItem )
02942     read ( unit=sItem, fmt=*, iostat=iStat ) pConfig%IRRIGATION(iRecNum)%rAlpha1
02943     call Assert( iStat == 0, &
02944       "Error reading shape coefficient (Alpha1) in irrigation lookup table" )
02945     write(UNIT=LU_LOG,FMT=*)  "   shape coefficient (Alpha1) ", &
02946         pConfig%IRRIGATION(iRecNum)%rAlpha1
02947 
02948     call Chomp_tab ( sRecord, sItem )
02949     read ( unit=sItem, fmt=*, iostat=iStat ) pConfig%IRRIGATION(iRecNum)%rGDD_Kc_Max
02950     call Assert( iStat == 0, &
02951       "Error reading GDD associated with max crop coefficient in irrigation lookup table" )
02952     write(UNIT=LU_LOG,FMT=*)  "   GDD associated with max crop coefficient ", &
02953         pConfig%IRRIGATION(iRecNum)%rGDD_Kc_Max
02954 
02955     call Chomp_tab ( sRecord, sItem )
02956     read ( unit=sItem, fmt=*, iostat=iStat ) pConfig%IRRIGATION(iRecNum)%rGDD_Death
02957     call Assert( iStat == 0, &
02958       "Error reading GDD associated with plant death in irrigation lookup table" )
02959     write(UNIT=LU_LOG,FMT=*)  "   GDD associated with plant death ", &
02960         pConfig%IRRIGATION(iRecNum)%rGDD_Death
02961 
02962     call Chomp_tab ( sRecord, sItem )
02963     read ( unit=sItem, fmt=*, iostat=iStat ) pConfig%IRRIGATION(iRecNum)%rGDD_BaseTemp
02964     call Assert( iStat == 0, &
02965       "Error reading GDD base temperature in irrigation lookup table" )
02966     write(UNIT=LU_LOG,FMT=*)  "   GDD base temperature ", &
02967         pConfig%IRRIGATION(iRecNum)%rGDD_BaseTemp
02968 
02969     call Chomp_tab ( sRecord, sItem )
02970     read ( unit=sItem, fmt=*, iostat=iStat ) pConfig%IRRIGATION(iRecNum)%rGDD_MaxTemp
02971     call Assert( iStat == 0, &
02972       "Error reading GDD max temperature in irrigation lookup table" )
02973     write(UNIT=LU_LOG,FMT=*)  "   GDD max temperature ", &
02974         pConfig%IRRIGATION(iRecNum)%rGDD_MaxTemp
02975 
02976     call Chomp_tab ( sRecord, sItem )
02977     read ( unit=sItem, fmt=*, iostat=iStat ) pConfig%IRRIGATION(iRecNum)%rMAD
02978     call Assert( iStat == 0, &
02979       "Error reading management allowable deficit (MAD) in irrigation lookup table" )
02980     write(UNIT=LU_LOG,FMT=*)  "   management allowable deficit (MAD) ", &
02981         pConfig%IRRIGATION(iRecNum)%rMAD
02982 
02983     call Chomp_tab ( sRecord, sItem )
02984     pConfig%IRRIGATION(iRecNum)%iBeginIrrigation = mmddyyyy2doy(sItem)
02985     write(UNIT=LU_LOG,FMT=*)  "   irrigation starts on or after day ", &
02986         pConfig%IRRIGATION(iRecNum)%iBeginIrrigation
02987 
02988     call Chomp_tab ( sRecord, sItem )
02989     pConfig%IRRIGATION(iRecNum)%iEndIrrigation = mmddyyyy2doy(sItem)
02990     write(UNIT=LU_LOG,FMT=*)  "   irrigation ends on day ", &
02991         pConfig%IRRIGATION(iRecNum)%iEndIrrigation
02992 
02993     iRecNum = iRecNum + 1
02994 
02995   end do LU_READ
02996 
02997   ! That's all!
02998   close ( unit=LU_LOOKUP )
02999 
03000   return
03001 end subroutine model_ReadIrrigationLookupTable
03002 
03003 #endif
03004 
03005 !--------------------------------------------------------------------------
03006 
03007 function rf_model_GetInterception( pConfig, iType, iDayOfYear ) result(rIntRate)
03008   !! Looks up the interception value for land-use type iType.
03009   ! [ ARGUMENTS ]
03010   type (T_MODEL_CONFIGURATION), pointer :: pConfig ! pointer to data structure that contains
03011                                                    ! model options, flags, and other settings
03012   integer (kind=T_SHORT), intent(in) :: iType
03013   integer (kind=T_INT), intent(in) :: iDayOfYear
03014   ! [ RETURN VALUE ]
03015   real (kind=T_SGL) :: rIntRate
03016   ! [ LOCALS ]
03017   integer ( kind=T_INT ) :: i
03018   type ( T_LANDUSE_LOOKUP ),pointer :: pLU
03019 
03020   ! Default is zero
03021   rIntRate = rZERO
03022   ! Search the default values
03023   do i = 1,size(pConfig%LU,1)
03024     pLU => pConfig%LU(i)
03025     if ( pLU%iLandUseType == iType ) then
03026       if ( lf_model_GrowingSeason(pConfig, iDayOfYear) ) then
03027         rIntRate = pLU%rIntercept_GrowingSeason
03028       else
03029         rIntRate = pLU%rIntercept_NonGrowingSeason
03030       end if
03031       exit
03032     end if
03033   end do
03034 
03035   call Assert(LOGICAL(rIntRate >= rZERO,kind=T_LOGICAL), 
03036     "Negative value was determined for interception. Check your lookup tables.")
03037 
03038   return
03039 end function rf_model_GetInterception
03040 
03041 !--------------------------------------------------------------------------
03042 
03043 subroutine model_InitializeET( pGrd, pConfig )
03044   !! Depending on the ET model in use, initializes the values for ET
03045   !! calculations.
03046   ! [ ARGUMENTS ]
03047   type ( T_GENERAL_GRID ),pointer :: pGrd          ! pointer to model grid
03048   type (T_MODEL_CONFIGURATION), pointer :: pConfig ! pointer to data structure that contains
03049                                                    ! model options, flags, and other settings
03050 
03051 
03052   write(UNIT=LU_LOG,FMT=*)  "model_InitializeET : "
03053   write(UNIT=LU_LOG,FMT=*)  "  filename = ", TRIM(pConfig%sTimeSeriesFilename)
03054 
03055   select case ( pConfig%iConfigureET )
03056     case ( CONFIG_ET_NONE )
03057       call Assert( .false._T_LOGICAL, "No ET configuration was specified" )
03058     case ( CONFIG_ET_THORNTHWAITE_MATHER )
03059       call et_tm_initialize ( pGrd, pConfig, pConfig%sTimeSeriesFilename)
03060     case ( CONFIG_ET_TURC )
03061       call et_turc_initialize ( pGrd, pConfig%sTimeSeriesFilename)
03062     case ( CONFIG_ET_JENSEN_HAISE )
03063       call et_jh_initialize ( pGrd, pConfig%sTimeSeriesFilename)
03064     case ( CONFIG_ET_BLANEY_CRIDDLE )
03065       call et_bc_initialize ( pGrd, pConfig%sTimeSeriesFilename)
03066     case ( CONFIG_ET_HARGREAVES )
03067       call et_hargreaves_initialize ( pGrd, pConfig%sTimeSeriesFilename)
03068   end select
03069 
03070   return
03071 end subroutine model_InitializeET
03072 
03073 !--------------------------------------------------------------------------
03074 
03075 subroutine model_ProcessET( pGrd, pConfig, iDayOfYear, iNumDaysInYear, &
03076      rRH, rMinRH, rWindSpd, rSunPct )
03077   !! Depending on the ET model in use, computes the potential ET for each
03078   !! cell, based on the meteorological data given. Stores cell-by-cell PET
03079   !! values in the model grid.
03080   !!
03081   ! [ ARGUMENTS ]
03082   type ( T_GENERAL_GRID ),pointer :: pGrd          ! pointer to model grid
03083   type (T_MODEL_CONFIGURATION), pointer :: pConfig ! pointer to data structure that contains
03084                                                    ! model options, flags, and other settings
03085   integer (kind=T_INT),intent(in) :: iDayOfYear, iNumDaysInYear
03086   real (kind=T_SGL),intent(in) :: rRH,rMinRH,rWindSpd,rSunPct
03087 
03088   ! [ LOCALS ]
03089   type (T_CELL),pointer :: cel                      ! pointer to a particular cell
03090   type (T_IRRIGATION_LOOKUP),pointer :: pIRRIGATION  ! pointer to an irrigation table entry
03091   integer (kind=T_INT) :: iCol, iRow
03092 
03093   select case ( pConfig%iConfigureET )
03094     case ( CONFIG_ET_NONE )
03095       call Assert( .false._T_LOGICAL, "No ET configuration was specified" )
03096     case ( CONFIG_ET_THORNTHWAITE_MATHER )
03097       call et_tm_ComputeET ( pGrd, pConfig, iDayOfYear, rRH, rMinRH, &
03098                             rWindSpd, rSunPct)
03099     case ( CONFIG_ET_TURC )
03100       call et_turc_ComputeET ( pGrd, iDayOfYear, rRH, rSunPct)
03101     case ( CONFIG_ET_JENSEN_HAISE )
03102       call et_jh_ComputeET ( pGrd, iDayOfYear, rRH, rMinRH, &
03103                             rWindSpd, rSunPct)
03104     case ( CONFIG_ET_BLANEY_CRIDDLE )
03105       call et_bc_ComputeET ( pGrd, iDayOfYear, rRH, rMinRH, &
03106                             rWindSpd, rSunPct)
03107     case ( CONFIG_ET_HARGREAVES )
03108       call et_hargreaves_ComputeET ( pGrd, pConfig, iDayOfYear, iNumDaysInYear)
03109   end select
03110 
03111 #ifdef IRRIGATION_MODULE
03112 
03113   ! modify potential ET by the crop coefficient
03114   do iCol=1,pGrd%iNX  ! last index in a Fortan array should be the slowest changing
03115     do iRow=1,pGrd%iNY
03116       cel => pGrd%Cells(iRow,iCol)
03117       pIRRIGATION => pConfig%IRRIGATION(cel%iLandUseIndex)
03118 
03119       cel%rSM_PotentialET = cel%rSM_PotentialET &
03120           * calc_crop_coefficient(pIRRIGATION%rKc_Max, pIRRIGATION%rK0, &
03121                pIRRIGATION%rGDD_Kc_Max, pIRRIGATION%rGDD_Death, pIRRIGATION%rAlpha1, cel%rGDD)
03122 
03123       ! if the ground is still frozen, we're not going to consider ET to be
03124       ! possible.
03125       if(cel%rCFGI > rNEAR_ZERO)  cel%rSM_PotentialET = rZERO
03126 
03127     enddo
03128   enddo
03129 
03130 #endif
03131 
03132 !  call stats_WriteMinMeanMax( LU_STD_OUT, "POTENTIAL ET", pGrd%Cells%rSM_PotentialET )
03133 
03134   return
03135 end subroutine model_ProcessET
03136 
03137 !--------------------------------------------------------------------------
03138 
03139 subroutine model_ProcessSM( pGrd, pConfig, iDayOfYear, iDay, iMonth, iYear)
03140   !! Depending on the SM model in use, computes the change in soil moisture
03141   !! and also the recharge (if any) for each cell in the grid, given the
03142   !! precipitation rPrecip and the snow melt rSnowMelt
03143   !!
03144   ! [ ARGUMENTS ]
03145   type ( T_GENERAL_GRID ),pointer :: pGrd         ! pointer to model grid
03146   type (T_MODEL_CONFIGURATION), pointer :: pConfig ! pointer to data structure that contains
03147                                                    ! model options, flags, and other settings
03148 
03149   integer (kind=T_INT),intent(in) :: iDayOfYear
03150   integer (kind=T_INT),intent(in) :: iDay
03151   integer (kind=T_INT),intent(in) :: iMonth
03152   integer (kind=T_INT),intent(in) :: iYear
03153 
03154   select case ( pConfig%iConfigureSM )
03155     case ( CONFIG_SM_NONE )
03156       call Assert( .false._T_LOGICAL, "No soil moisture calculation method was specified" )
03157     case ( CONFIG_SM_THORNTHWAITE_MATHER )
03158       call sm_thornthwaite_mather_UpdateSM (pGrd, pConfig, &
03159            iDayOfYear, iDay, iMonth,iYear)
03160   end select
03161 
03162   return
03163 end subroutine model_ProcessSM
03164 
03165 !--------------------------------------------------------------------------
03166 
03167 subroutine model_InitializeSM(pGrd, pConfig )
03168   !! Depending on the SM model in use, computes the change in soil moisture
03169   !! and also the recharge (if any) for each cell in the grid, given the
03170   !! precipitation rPrecip and the snow melt rSnowMelt
03171   !!
03172   ! [ ARGUMENTS ]
03173   type ( T_GENERAL_GRID ),pointer :: pGrd         ! pointer to model grid
03174   type (T_MODEL_CONFIGURATION), pointer :: pConfig ! pointer to data structure that contains
03175                                                    ! model options, flags, and other settings
03176   ! [ LOCALS ]
03177   integer (kind=T_INT) :: iCol,iRow,k
03178   type ( T_CELL ),pointer :: cel            ! pointer to cell data structure
03179   type ( T_LANDUSE_LOOKUP ),pointer :: pLU  ! pointer to landuse data structure
03180   logical ( kind=T_LOGICAL ) :: lMatch
03181 
03182   ! [ LOCAL PARAMETERS ]
03183 
03184   if(pConfig%iConfigureSMCapacity==CONFIG_SM_CAPACITY_CALCULATE) then
03185     ! Update the soil-water capacity based on land-cover and soil type
03186     do iCol=1,pGrd%iNX
03187       do iRow=1,pGrd%iNY
03188 
03189         lMatch = lFALSE
03190         cel => pGrd%Cells(iRow,iCol)
03191         ! loop over all LAND USE types...
03192         do k=1,size(pConfig%LU,1)
03193           pLU => pConfig%LU(k)
03194           if ( pLU%iLandUseType == cel%iLandUse ) then
03195 !            if( pLU%lCONSTANT_ROOT_ZONE_DEPTH ) then
03196 
03197               cel%rSoilWaterCap = cel%rSoilWaterCapInput * &
03198                 pConfig%ROOTING_DEPTH(k,cel%iSoilGroup)
03199 
03200 !            else
03201 !              cel%rSoilWaterCap = cel%rSoilWaterCapInput * &
03202 !                interpolate(pLU%rX_ROOT_ZONE,pLU%rY_ROOT_ZONE,cel%rSoilWaterCapInput)
03203 !            end if
03204 !            if(cel%iLandUse == 82) then
03205 !             write(UNIT=LU_LOG,FMT=*)  "LU:", cel%iLandUse,"  SOIL:",cel%iSoilGroup,"  out:", &
03206 !              "  in:",cel%rSoilWaterCapInput,"  product:",cel%rSoilWaterCap
03207 !             write(UNIT=LU_LOG,FMT=*)  "   ",pLU%rX_ROOT_ZONE
03208 !             write(UNIT=LU_LOG,FMT=*)  "   ",pLU%rY_ROOT_ZONE
03209 !            endif
03210             lMatch=lTRUE
03211             exit
03212           end if
03213         end do
03214 !      write(UNIT=LU_LOG,FMT=*)  iRow,iCol," table: ",pLU%iLandUseType," cell: ",cel%iLandUse
03215         if(.not. lMATCH) then
03216           write(UNIT=LU_LOG,FMT=*)  "iRow: ",iRow,"  iCol: ",iCol,"  cell LU: ", cel%iLandUse
03217           call Assert(lFALSE,&
03218           "Failed to match landuse grid with landuse table during soil moisture initialization")
03219         endif
03220       end do
03221     end do
03222   end if
03223 
03224   select case ( pConfig%iConfigureSM )
03225     case ( CONFIG_SM_NONE )
03226       call Assert( lFALSE, "No soil moisture calculation method was specified" )
03227     case ( CONFIG_SM_THORNTHWAITE_MATHER )
03228       call sm_thornthwaite_mather_Initialize ( pGrd, pConfig )
03229   end select
03230 
03231   return
03232 end subroutine model_InitializeSM
03233 
03234 
03235 !--------------------------------------------------------------------------
03236 
03237 subroutine model_InitializeMaxInfil(pGrd, pConfig )
03238   !!
03239   ! [ ARGUMENTS ]
03240   type ( T_GENERAL_GRID ),pointer :: pGrd         ! pointer to model grid
03241   type (T_MODEL_CONFIGURATION), pointer :: pConfig ! pointer to data structure that contains
03242                                                    ! model options, flags, and other settings
03243   ! [ LOCALS ]
03244   integer (kind=T_INT) :: iCol,iRow,k
03245   type ( T_CELL ),pointer :: cel            ! pointer to cell data structure
03246   type ( T_LANDUSE_LOOKUP ),pointer :: pLU  ! pointer to landuse data structure
03247   logical ( kind=T_LOGICAL ) :: lMatch
03248 
03249   ! Update the MAXIMUM RECHARGE RATE based on land-cover and soil type
03250   do iCol=1,pGrd%iNX
03251     do iRow=1,pGrd%iNY
03252 
03253       lMatch = lFALSE
03254       cel => pGrd%Cells(iRow,iCol)
03255       do k=1,size(pConfig%LU,1)
03256         pLU => pConfig%LU(k)
03257         if ( pLU%iLandUseType == cel%iLandUse ) then
03258           ! save index of matching landuse for ease of processing land use properties later
03259           cel%iLandUseIndex = k
03260           ! need to ensure that the soil type doesn't exceed
03261           ! the max number of soil types or we get a core dump
03262           call Assert(LOGICAL(INT(cel%iSoilGroup,kind=T_INT) &
            <= size(pConfig%MAX_RECHARGE,2),kind=T_LOGICAL), 
03263             "Value in soil type grid exceeds the maximum " 
03264             // "number of soil types in the land use lookup table.")
03265           cel%rMaxRecharge = pConfig%MAX_RECHARGE(k,INT(cel%iSoilGroup,kind=T_INT))
03266           lMatch=lTRUE
03267           exit
03268         end if
03269       end do
03270         if(.not. lMATCH) then
03271           write(UNIT=LU_LOG,FMT=*) "iRow: ",iRow,"  iCol: ",iCol,"  cell LU: ", cel%iLandUse
03272           call Assert(lFALSE,&
03273           "Failed to match landuse grid with landuse table during maximum infiltration initialization")
03274         endif
03275     end do
03276   end do
03277 
03278   return
03279 end subroutine model_InitializeMaxInfil
03280 
03281 !--------------------------------------------------------------------------
03282 
03283 subroutine model_WriteGrids(pGrd, pConfig, sMonthName, iDay,iMonth, &
03284     iYear, iDayOfYear)
03285   !! Writes the monthly output arrays in the proper grid format
03286   ! [ ARGUMENTS ]
03287   type ( T_GENERAL_GRID ),pointer :: pGrd        ! pointer to model grid
03288   type (T_MODEL_CONFIGURATION), pointer :: pConfig ! pointer to data structure that contains
03289                                                    ! model options, flags, and other settings
03290   character (len=*),intent(in) :: sMonthName
03291   integer (kind=T_INT), intent(in) :: iDayOfYear, iMonth, iDay, iYear
03292 
03293   ! [ LOCALS ]
03294   real (kind=T_DBL) :: xmin,xmax,ymin,ymax
03295   character (len=256) sBufOut,sBufFuture,sBufSuffix,sDayText,sMonthText, 
03296                          sYearText
03297 
03298   sBufOut = "output"//pConfig%sSlash//trim(sMonthName)
03299   sBufFuture = "output"//pConfig%sSlash//"future"//pConfig%sSlash
03300   sBufSuffix = trim(pConfig%sOutputFileSuffix)
03301 
03302   write(sDayText,fmt="(a1,i2.2,a1,i2.2,a1,i4)") "_",iMonth,"_",iDay,"_",iYear
03303   write(sMonthText,fmt="(a1,i2.2,a1,i4)") "_",iMonth,"_",iYear
03304   write(sYearText,fmt="(a1,i4)") "_",iYear
03305 
03306   xmin = pGrd%rX0
03307   xmax = pGrd%rX1
03308   ymin = pGrd%rY0
03309   ymax = pGrd%rY1
03310 
03311   if ( pConfig%iOutputFormat == OUTPUT_ARC ) then
03312     if(MAXVAL(pGrd%Cells%rMSB)>0.1) then
03313       call grid_WriteArcGrid("MASS_BALANCE" // &
03314         trim(sDayText) // "." //trim(sBufSuffix), &
03315         xmin,xmax,ymin,ymax,pGrd%Cells(:,:)%rMSB )
03316     elseif ( trim(sMonthName) == "ANNUAL" ) then
03317 !      call grid_WriteArcGrid( trim(sBufOut) // "_rch." // trim(sBufSuffix), &
03318 !               xmin,xmax,ymin,ymax,pGrd%Cells(:,:)%rAnnualRecharge )
03319 !      call grid_WriteArcGrid(trim(sBufOut) // "_pot_et." // trim(sBufSuffix), &
03320 !          xmin,xmax,ymin,ymax,pGrd%Cells(:,:)%rAnnualPotET )
03321 !      call grid_WriteArcGrid(trim(sBufOut) // "_act_et." // trim(sBufSuffix), &
03322 !          xmin,xmax,ymin,ymax,pGrd%Cells(:,:)%rAnnualActET )
03323       call grid_WriteArcGrid(trim(sBufFuture) // "final_pct_sm" // &
03324         trim(sYearText) // "." //trim(sBufSuffix), &
03325           xmin,xmax,ymin,ymax,pGrd%Cells(:,:)%rSoilMoisturePct )
03326       call grid_WriteArcGrid(trim(sBufFuture) // "final_snow_cover" // &
03327         trim(sYearText) // "." //trim(sBufSuffix), &
03328           xmin,xmax,ymin,ymax,pGrd%Cells(:,:)%rSnowCover )
03329 !      call grid_WriteArcGrid(trim(sBufOut) // "_soil_water_cap" // &
03330 !        trim(sYearText) // "." //trim(sBufSuffix), &
03331 !          xmin,xmax,ymin,ymax,pGrd%Cells(:,:)%rSoilWaterCap )
03332     else if ( sMonthName(1:3) == 'day' ) then
03333 !      call grid_WriteArcGrid("precip." // sMonthName(4:6), &
03334 !          xmin,xmax,ymin,ymax,pGrd%Cells(:,:)%rGrossPrecip )
03335 !      call grid_WriteArcGrid("output/daily/ALT_recharge" // trim(sDayText) // &
03336 !          "." // sBufSuffix, &
03337 !          xmin,xmax,ymin,ymax,pGrd%Cells(:,:)%rDailyRecharge )
03338 
03339 !        call grid_WriteArcGrid("output\\daily\\pot_et" // trim(sDayText) // &
03340 !          "." // sBufSuffix, &
03341 !          xmin,xmax,ymin,ymax,pGrd%Cells(:,:)%rSM_PotentialET )
03342 !        call grid_WriteArcGrid("output\\act_et." // sMonthName(4:6), &
03343 !          xmin,xmax,ymin,ymax,pGrd%Cells(:,:)%rSM_ActualET )
03344 !        call grid_WriteArcGrid("output\\net_infil." // sMonthName(4:6), &
03345 !          xmin,xmax,ymin,ymax,pGrd%Cells(:,:)%rNetInfil )
03346 !        call grid_WriteArcGrid("output\\daily\\inflow" // trim(sDayText) // &
03347 !          "." // sBufSuffix, &
03348 !          xmin,xmax,ymin,ymax,pGrd%Cells(:,:)%rInFlow )
03349 !        call grid_WriteArcGrid("output\\daily\\outflow" // trim(sDayText) // &
03350 !          "." // sBufSuffix, &
03351 !          xmin,xmax,ymin,ymax,pGrd%Cells(:,:)%rOutFlow )
03352 !        call grid_WriteArcGrid("output\\daily\\soil_mois" // trim(sDayText) // &
03353 !          "." // sBufSuffix, &
03354 !            xmin,xmax,ymin,ymax,pGrd%Cells(:,:)%rSoilMoisture )
03355 !        call grid_WriteArcGrid("output\\daily\\curve_num" // trim(sDayText) // &
03356 !          "." // sBufSuffix, &
03357 !            xmin,xmax,ymin,ymax,pGrd%Cells(:,:)%rAdjCN )
03358 !        call grid_WriteArcGrid("output\\daily\\snow_cov" // trim(sDayText) // &
03359 !          "." // sBufSuffix, &
03360 !            xmin,xmax,ymin,ymax,pGrd%Cells(:,:)%rSnowCover )
03361 
03362     else
03363 
03364 !      call grid_WriteArcGrid(trim(sBufOut) // "_rch"// trim(sMonthText) // &
03365 !          "." // sBufSuffix, &
03366 !          xmin,xmax,ymin,ymax,pGrd%Cells(:,:)%rMonthlyRecharge )
03367 !      call grid_WriteArcGrid(trim(sBufOut) // "_pot_et." // trim(sBufSuffix), &
03368 !          xmin,xmax,ymin,ymax,pGrd%Cells(:,:)%rMonthlyPotET )
03369 !      call grid_WriteArcGrid(trim(sBufOut) // "_act_et." // trim(sBufSuffix), &
03370 !          xmin,xmax,ymin,ymax,pGrd%Cells(:,:)%rMonthlyActET )
03371 !      call grid_WriteArcGrid(trim(sBufOut) // "_inflow." // trim(sBufSuffix), &
03372 !          xmin,xmax,ymin,ymax,pGrd%Cells(:,:)%rMonthlyInFlow )
03373 !      call grid_WriteArcGrid(trim(sBufOut) // "_outflow." // trim(sBufSuffix), &
03374 !          xmin,xmax,ymin,ymax,pGrd%Cells(:,:)%rMonthlyOutFlow )
03375 !        call grid_WriteArcGrid(trim(sBufOut) // "_sm." // trim(sBufSuffix), &
03376 !            xmin,xmax,ymin,ymax,pGrd%Cells(:,:)%rSoilMoisture )
03377     end if
03378   else if ( pConfig%iOutputFormat == OUTPUT_SURFER ) then
03379     if(MAXVAL(pGrd%Cells%rMSB)>0.1) then
03380       call grid_WriteSurferGrid("MASS_BALANCE" // &
03381         trim(sDayText) // "." //trim(sBufSuffix), &
03382         xmin,xmax,ymin,ymax,pGrd%Cells(:,:)%rMSB )
03383     elseif ( trim(sMonthName) == "ANNUAL" ) then
03384 !      call grid_WriteSurferGrid(trim(sBufOut) // "_rch." // trim(sBufSuffix), &
03385 !          xmin,xmax,ymin,ymax,pGrd%Cells(:,:)%rAnnualRecharge )
03386 !      call grid_WriteSurferGrid(trim(sBufOut) // "_pot_et." // trim(sBufSuffix), &
03387 !          xmin,xmax,ymin,ymax,pGrd%Cells(:,:)%rAnnualPotET )
03388 !      call grid_WriteSurferGrid(trim(sBufOut) // "_act_et." // trim(sBufSuffix), &
03389 !          xmin,xmax,ymin,ymax,pGrd%Cells(:,:)%rAnnualActET )
03390       call grid_WriteSurferGrid(trim(sBufFuture) // "final_pct_sm" // &
03391         trim(sYearText) // "." //trim(sBufSuffix), &
03392           xmin,xmax,ymin,ymax,pGrd%Cells(:,:)%rSoilMoisturePct )
03393       call grid_WriteSurferGrid(trim(sBufFuture) // "final_snow_cover" // &
03394         trim(sYearText) // "." //trim(sBufSuffix), &
03395           xmin,xmax,ymin,ymax,pGrd%Cells(:,:)%rSnowCover )
03396 !      call grid_WriteSurferGrid(trim(sBufOut) // "_soil_water_cap" // &
03397 !        trim(sYearText) // "." //trim(sBufSuffix), &
03398 !          xmin,xmax,ymin,ymax,pGrd%Cells(:,:)%rSoilWaterCap )
03399 
03400     else if ( sMonthName(1:3) == 'day' ) then
03401 
03402 !      call grid_WriteSurferGrid("output\\recharge." // sMonthName(4:6), &
03403 !          xmin,xmax,ymin,ymax,pGrd%Cells(:,:)%rDailyRecharge )
03404 
03405 !        call grid_WriteSurferGrid("output\\daily\\pot_et." // sMonthName(4:6), &
03406 !          xmin,xmax,ymin,ymax,pGrd%Cells(:,:)%rSM_PotentialET )
03407 !        call grid_WriteSurferGrid("output\\act_et." // sMonthName(4:6), &
03408 !          xmin,xmax,ymin,ymax,pGrd%Cells(:,:)%rSM_ActualET )
03409 !        call grid_WriteSurferGrid("output\\net_infil." // sMonthName(4:6), &
03410 !          xmin,xmax,ymin,ymax,pGrd%Cells(:,:)%rNetInfil )
03411 !        call grid_WriteSurferGrid("output\\daily\\inflow." // sMonthName(4:6), &
03412 !          xmin,xmax,ymin,ymax,pGrd%Cells(:,:)%rInFlow )
03413 !        call grid_WriteSurferGrid("output\\daily\\outflow." // sMonthName(4:6), &
03414 !          xmin,xmax,ymin,ymax,pGrd%Cells(:,:)%rOutFlow )
03415 
03416 !        call grid_WriteSurferGrid("output\\daily\\soil_mois." // sMonthName(4:6), &
03417 !            xmin,xmax,ymin,ymax,pGrd%Cells(:,:)%rSoilMoisture )
03418 !        call grid_WriteSurferGrid("output\\daily\\curve_num." // sMonthName(4:6), &
03419 !            xmin,xmax,ymin,ymax,pGrd%Cells(:,:)%rAdjCN )
03420 !        call grid_WriteSurferGrid("output\\daily\\snow_cov." // sMonthName(4:6), &
03421 !            xmin,xmax,ymin,ymax,pGrd%Cells(:,:)%rSnowCover )
03422 
03423     else
03424 !      call grid_WriteSurferGrid(trim(sBufOut) // "_rch." // trim(sBufSuffix), &
03425 !          xmin,xmax,ymin,ymax,pGrd%Cells(:,:)%rMonthlyRecharge )
03426 !      call grid_WriteSurferGrid(trim(sBufOut) // "_pot_et." // trim(sBufSuffix), &
03427 !          xmin,xmax,ymin,ymax,pGrd%Cells(:,:)%rMonthlyPotET )
03428 !      call grid_WriteSurferGrid(trim(sBufOut) // "_act_et." // trim(sBufSuffix), &
03429 !          xmin,xmax,ymin,ymax,pGrd%Cells(:,:)%rMonthlyActET )
03430 !      call grid_WriteSurferGrid(trim(sBufOut) // "_inflow." // trim(sBufSuffix), &
03431 !          xmin,xmax,ymin,ymax,pGrd%Cells(:,:)%rMonthlyInFlow )
03432 !      call grid_WriteSurferGrid(trim(sBufOut) // "_outflow." // trim(sBufSuffix), &
03433 !          xmin,xmax,ymin,ymax,pGrd%Cells(:,:)%rMonthlyOutFlow )
03434 !        call grid_WriteSurferGrid(trim(sBufOut) // "_sm." // trim(sBufSuffix), &
03435 !            xmin,xmax,ymin,ymax,pGrd%Cells(:,:)%rSoilMoisture )
03436     end if
03437   else
03438     call Assert( .false._T_LOGICAL, "Illegal output format specified" )
03439   end if
03440 
03441   return
03442 end subroutine model_WriteGrids
03443 
03444 #ifdef NETCDF_SUPPORT
03445 
03446 subroutine model_write_NetCDF_attributes(pConfig, pGrd)
03447   ! this code block initializes NetCDF output files for any
03448   ! valid SWB variable, as specified in the OUTPUT_OPTIONS
03449   ! input block
03450 
03451     type ( T_GENERAL_GRID ),pointer :: pGrd        ! pointer to model grid
03452     type (T_MODEL_CONFIGURATION), pointer :: pConfig      ! pointer to data structure that contains
03453                                                         ! model options, flags, and other settings
03454     ! [ LOCALS ]
03455     integer (kind=T_INT) :: k
03456     type (T_NETCDF_FILE), pointer :: pNC
03457 
03458     do k=1,iNUM_VARIABLES
03459 
03460       if(STAT_INFO(k)%iNetCDFOutput > iNONE ) then
03461 
03462         pNC => pConfig%NETCDF_FILE(k,iNC_OUTPUT)
03463         pNC%sVarName = TRIM(STAT_INFO(k)%sVARIABLE_NAME)
03464         pNC%sUnits =  TRIM(STAT_INFO(k)%sUNITS)
03465         pNC%rScaleFactor = STAT_INFO(k)%rNC_MultFactor
03466         pNC%rAddOffset = STAT_INFO(k)%rNC_AddOffset
03467         pNC%iNCID = netcdf_create(TRIM(pNC%sVarName)//".nc")
03468         call netcdf_write_attributes(k, iNC_OUTPUT, pConfig, pGrd)
03469         write(unit=LU_LOG,FMT="('Wrote attributes to NetCDF file--')")
03470         write(unit=LU_LOG,FMT="('      k: ',i4,'  (',a,')')") k,TRIM(pNC%sVarName)
03471         write(unit=LU_LOG,FMT="('      NDIC: ',i4)") pNC%iNCID
03472       end if
03473 
03474     end do
03475 
03476     return
03477 
03478 end subroutine model_write_NetCDF_attributes
03479 
03480 #endif
03481 
03482 ! read a single line from the time-series file and return a pointer to the values
03483 subroutine model_ReadTimeSeriesFile(pTS)
03484 
03485   type (T_TIME_SERIES_FILE), pointer :: pTS
03486 
03487   ! [ LOCALS ]
03488   character(len=256) :: sBuf
03489   integer (kind=T_INT) :: iStat
03490 
03491   do
03492 
03493     read ( unit=LU_TS, fmt="(a256)", iostat=iStat ) sBuf
03494     if ( iStat<0 ) then
03495       pTS%lEOF = lTRUE
03496       exit ! END OF FILE
03497     end if
03498     call Assert ( iStat == 0, &
03499               "Cannot read record from time-series file", &
03500               TRIM(__FILE__),__LINE__)
03501     if ( sBuf(1:1) == '#' ) cycle      ! Ignore comment statements
03502     call CleanUpCsv ( sBuf )
03503     read ( unit=sBuf, fmt=*, iostat=iStat ) pTS%iMonth, pTS%iDay, &
03504        pTS%iYear, pTS%rAvgT, pTS%rPrecip, pTS%rRH, pTS%rMaxT, pTS%rMinT, &
03505        pTS%rWindSpd, pTS%rMinRH, pTS%rSunPct
03506     if (iStat/=0) then
03507       write(UNIT=LU_LOG,FMT=*) "Skipping: ",trim(sBuf)
03508       write(UNIT=LU_LOG,FMT=*)
03509       cycle
03510     end if
03511 
03512     if(pTS%rMaxT< -100 .or. pTS%rMinT < -100 .or. pTS%rMaxT < pTS%rMinT &
03513        .or. pTS%rPrecip < 0.) then
03514       write(UNIT=LU_LOG,fmt=*) &
03515         "Missing or corrupt data in climate file"
03516       call Assert(lFALSE, &
03517         "Input: "//TRIM(sBuf),TRIM(__FILE__),__LINE__)
03518     end if
03519 
03520     exit
03521 
03522   end do
03523 
03524   return
03525 
03526 end subroutine model_ReadTimeSeriesFile
03527 
03528 end module model
